clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Evaluation of Gastric Emptying in Diabetic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Cohort Study of Ultrasound Evaluation of Gastric Emptying in Diabetic Patients: a Comparison With Healthy Controls

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective cohort study. The main objective is to compare the frequency of a "full stomach" in the diabetic population compared to healthy controls 2 h after clear liquid and 6h after a light meal, and evaluate the mean gastric emptying time of clear liquid and light meal in diabetic patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with full stomach
primary_outcome.description: The main objective is to compare the frequency of a "full stomach" in the diabetic population compared to a healthy control population 2h after clear liquid or 6h after light meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: the mean gastric emptying time of clear liquid and light meal
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the mean gastric emptying time of clear liquid and light meal in the diabetic population

other_outcome.measure: Correlation of diabetes mellitus complications with delayed stomach empty
other_outcome.description: To assess whether there is significant correlation between diabetes mellitus related eye disease, cardiovascular cardiovascular autonomic neuropathy, peripheral neuropathy (MNSI) with delayed stomach empty

study_pop.textblock: Study participants will be diabetic and non-diabetic patients whom are scheduled to undergo elective surgical procedures or heathy control. 150 participants will be recruited in total.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diabetic and non-diabetic Patients scheduled for elective surgery aged 18 to 85years American Society of Anesthesia physical status classification I to III Body mass index < 40 kg/ cm2.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy (currently or within the past 3 months) Previous surgery of the upper gastrointestinal tract Achalasia
